intro: Hymenopus heteromorphus var. glaber, commonly known as the smooth hymenopus, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves, which are typically lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
